metadata.title: CVE-2022-22760 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description: When importing resources using Web Workers, error messages woulddistinguish the difference between application/javascriptresponses and non-script responses. This could have been abused to learninformation cross-origin. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 97,Thunderbird < 91.6, and Firefox ESR < 91.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
